multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have rosy cheeks and I get sunburned easily.
Do you have any other similar symptoms like redness or irritation on other parts of your face, like your nose or chin?
Yes, there is redness on my nose and ears too.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing these symptoms of redness and sunburn easily for quite some time now.
Do you experience any other facial symptoms such as itching, swelling, or bumps when the redness occurs?
No, I do not experience itching, swelling, or bumps with the redness.
Have you noticed any triggers that seem to make your symptoms worse, like certain weather conditions or consuming specific types of foods or beverages?
Yes, exposure to sunlight tends to make my symptoms worse.
Do you have any family history of similar skin conditions or other autoimmune diseases?
I'm not sure about my family history regarding similar skin conditions or autoimmune diseases.
Have you used any new skincare products or medications recently that might have coincided with the onset of these symptoms?
No, I haven't used any new skincare products or medications recently.
Final Diagnosis: Rosacea

I have rosy cheeks, I sunburn easily, and I get respiratory infections often.
Have you noticed any patterns or triggers that seem to exacerbate your facial redness?
Yes, my facial redness seems to get worse when I'm exposed to sunlight.
Do you experience any facial discomfort like burning or itching along with the redness?
No, I don't experience any burning or itching along with the redness.

I've been experiencing these symptoms for a long time.

Yes, genetic testing revealed a BLM/RECQL3 mutation which might be related.
Final Diagnosis: Bloom Syndrome
